items.q: What is the recommended risk per trade?
items.a: Professional traders typically risk 1-2% of their account balance per trade. This ensures you can survive a losing streak without blowing your account.
Pip value varies by instrument. For forex, it's based on contract size and leverage. For indices, it's based on the point value. Our calculator handles this automatically.

items.q: What is a good Risk:Reward ratio?
items.a: A minimum 1:2 ratio is recommended. This means for every $1 you risk, you aim to make $2. This allows you to be profitable even with a 40% win rate.

items.q: Can I use this for crypto trading?
items.a: Yes! The calculator supports Forex, Indices, Commodities, and Cryptocurrencies with accurate calculations for each asset class.

items.q: Do I need to create an account?
items.a: No! The risk calculator is 100% free and requires no sign-up. Just start calculating immediately.

items.q: How accurate are the margin calculations?
items.a: Our margin calculations are based on industry-standard formulas and are highly accurate for most brokers. Always verify with your specific broker's margin requirements.

items.q: What's the difference between the two calculator modes?
items.a: Risk Assessment mode evaluates an existing position. Position Sizing mode tells you the optimal lot size based on your risk tolerance.
Currently, calculations are session-based. You can export results to PDF or copy to clipboard for your records.
